attributes.action: Ban large boats from passing through swing bridges at peak times.
attributes.background:
1. EVERYONE who goes through that route will or probably will be late for work or their appointments
2. Emergency services get blocked from entry by the large amounts of traffic
3. Pollution - Every car passing the route will be sat in the same spot with the engine running for a good 20-30 minutes
attributes.additional_details:
Reasons why boats shouldn't be allowed to pass through swing bridges at peak times;
1. EVERYONE who goes through that route will or probably will be late for work or their appointments
2. Emergency services get blocked from entry by the large amounts of traffic. Dying? Tough - a boat needs to deliver a few boxes of car parts
3. Pollution - pretty much every car that is on its way home from work will be sat in the same spot with the engine running (unless it's stop start) for a good 20-30 minutes

attributes.action: Ban robotic trading of stocks, shares or financial derivatives
attributes.background: Robotic/algorithmic trading  of stocks, shares and financial derivatives are used by big corporates to steal money from retail investors.
attributes.additional_details: Big banks and institutions should not be allowed do use automatic trading which could cause flash crash in the markets eventually stealing money from weak hands of retail investors. Such trading should be banned. Markets would be less volatile and retail investors feel more secured to invest in such a situation.

attributes.action: Allow 16 year olds to ride motorcycles with a higher engine size than 50cc.
attributes.background: 16 years old are in danger of being taken off their bikes due to them being restricted and other volumes of traffic going at a much higher rate of speed past them, therefore increasing the accidents including young riders. 125cc would possibly be a better replacement as safer in the long term.
attributes.additional_details: At the moment the law states that 16 year olds cannot ride any motorcycle with an engine size higher than 50cc, this can be very dangerous as many roads now have speed limits way higher than this not allowing you to keep up with traffic or get out of a situation very quickly, therefore increasing the accidents including motorcycles and young riders. 125cc is a more sensible speed which is more reliable for young riders out on the roads at 16. To make sure it is safe for a young driver an additional test could be added allowing you to progress up rather than just a CBT, this time including a small theory

attributes.action: Educate people on buying bikes, bike safety and bike security.
attributes.background: So many people go off to buy cheap bikes and they have faults very quickly.So they throw it away or repair and replace parts often, this can a have a negative impact on the environment and people will ride bikes less, increasing the negative impact on the environment.We should ride bikes a lot more.

attributes.action: Remove  the Commercial speed restrictions on vehicles such as duel use pickups,
attributes.background: Vehicles such as Dual Cab pickups are still subjected to commercial speed restrictions on certain roads due to their curb weight even thou they are someone’s personal vehicle and not used for commercial use, remove these restrictions for personal use vehicles,
attributes.additional_details: If your pickup exceeds a unladen weight of 2048 kilos it has speed restrictions on certain roads which is rubbish as most modern cars such as range rovers weight sometimes over 3 tonne, just because a vehicle is deemed commercial doesn’t mean it should be restricted, personal use commercial vehicles not being used for business shouldn’t be subjected to this law, as new pick ups have better safety equipment than when this law was written,

attributes.action: To review current criminal law relating to rape and sexual offences.
attributes.background:
I would like the government to review current law and to implement a 3-point plan.

Educate - To make sexual education compulsory in all Secondary schools.
Prevent - Increased awareness around high-risk areas (nightclubs, pubs etc).
Prosecute - Increase current minimum term guideline for crimes.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe more can be done to reduce crime relating to rape and sexual offences. I am constantly heartbroken, daily, to read about it on the news. The crime is unforgivable and I think we have a duty as a society to call for more action which will protect the general public. 

- Approximately 85,000 women and 12,000 men are raped in England and Wales alone every year.
- Rape Crisis specialist services were accessed by 78,461 individuals an increase of 17% from 2016-17.

attributes.action: Take Pitbulls off the 1991 dangerous dog act.
attributes.background: Any dog can be dangerous, IF IT IS RAISED INCORRECTLY. Pitbulls shouldn’t be banned. It’s the owners fault for wrongly raising the dogs and action should be taken on owners and not the dogs.

attributes.action: Give cadet forces more funding + get all air cadets squadrons back in the sky.
attributes.background: Cadet funding is low, especially in areas such as the Thongsbridge detachment, as their cadet building is more of a mobile home than a building. Furthermore, more than half of the air cadet forces have had their volountier glider squadrons disbanded, meaning these air cadets can no longer fly planes
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/03/19/air-cadet-cuts-will-see-more-than-half-of-squadrons-axed/ - air cadets grounded evidence

https://armycadets.com/about-us/acf-structure/the-acfa/about-acfa/acfa-funding/ - Cadets are currently charity funded

https://www.sea-cadets.org/how-were-funded - sea cadets are funded by the individual cadets and fundraising

More cadet funding will help improve the cadet forces, teaching young people great skills and getting more kids off the streets.

attributes.action: Lower the legal driving age to 16
attributes.background: I believe that the legal driving age should be lowered to 16 in the UK just as it is in the USA, reason being that 16 year olds now have more responsibility and this would be made easier with the option to drive

attributes.action: Make it illegal for Holiday firms to increase prices in school holidays
attributes.background:
Parents who take children on unauthorised term-time holidays cannot escape fines and criminal records.
The right to affordable holidays is being taken away by the system.
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of parents arround the country  face a choice each year. Do they take their children out of school to go on a cheaper holidays.  Holiday prices during the School term are significantly cheaper than when taken during  official school holidays.
The government should look to ensure holidays during official holiday periods are affordable for all.
Safeguards should be legally put in place to prevent holidays firms over-inflating prices during key holiday periods.

attributes.action: Ban Animal circuses in the UK. It is animal cruelty and completely barbaric.
attributes.background: I am tired of seeing endless videos and stories all over the internet and news of animals being killed or showing signs of such unnatural distress simply for our entertainment. As humans and as a community it is our duty to keep moving forward from senseless, unnecessary and straight up callous acts

attributes.action: Make fire extinguishers mandatory in tower blocks
attributes.background: Many tower blocks don’t have the minimum safety in case a fire occurs and to prevent any further accident to spread, there should be a law forcing tower blocks to have fire extinguishers

attributes.action: Re-introduce free milk in primary and secondary schools
attributes.background: Free milk was a great way of making children that little bit happier about going to school, so now I believe we should reintroduce it back to schools

attributes.action: Stop the ban of menthol cigarettes when the UK leaves the EU
attributes.background: A cigarette is a cigarette menthol or not, it's just a preference as is coke with vodka. In 2020 menthol cigarettes were to be banned under new EU laws but the UK is preparing to leave the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst on the topic binge drinking seems to be a regular thing and alcohol also takes/ruins many lives but I don't see any graphic images or warnings on alcohol. End the menthol and flavoured tobacco ban in 2020 since the UK is leaving the EU.

attributes.action: Make using red flashing lights on recovery trucks mandatory.
attributes.background: In 2018 alone we have had some very tragic incidents on the roads that could of been prevented. A lack of concentration whilst driving at speed is killing innocent workers. More needs to be done to protect workers roadside. Hitting a stationary vehicle on the hard shoulder shouldn't happen.
attributes.additional_details:
Unlike blue flashing lights, amber lights grant no priority in traffic and are used to solely to emphasize a vehicle, often due to being a hazard. AKA non important
.Vehicles that use amber flashing lights include:

Road / highway maintenance vehicle 
Refuse collection vehicle
Breakdown recovery vehicle
the list goes on.

Most vehicles that do any kind of civil work have amber flashing lights, they are abused and misused, giving drivers the indication they are not important. This needs to change. All recovery trucks to have flashing reds fitted so motorist understand drivers need the room to operate. Workers to return home safe, not in a coffin.

attributes.action: Increase Child Benefit to £40 per child per week
attributes.background: There are 4.1 Million children in poverty in the UK. And another new 753 children fall in to poverty each day. The best way to tackle it is by increasing child benefits, so this will not prevent people from getting in to work, getting better jobs or better salaries as there is no taper rate for CB.
attributes.additional_details:
67% of children in poverty are from working families. https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-39291999
http://www.cpag.org.uk/content/child-poverty-facts-and-figures

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poverty_in_the_United_Kingdom#Poverty_in_the_UK_in_the_21st_century

https://www.google.co.uk/search?ei=m9U8W8DoGYuvgQb-6Z_IAg&q=how+to+end+poverty+in+uk+by+increasing+child+benefit+to+%C2%A340+per+week&oq=how+to+end+poverty+in+uk+by+increasing+child+benefit+to+%C2%A340+per+week&gs_l=psy-ab.3...10100.19683.0.20219.16.16.0.0.0.0.96.903.16.16.0....0...1c.1.64.psy-ab..0.4.241...33i160k1.0.mWs7Ge3vIsw&safe=active&ssui=on

attributes.action: Add recycling to the curriculum. Even if it's 1 day a year - possibly a visit.
attributes.background:
Incorrect recycling costs taxes.
I received a leaflet about what can be recycled in my area. It also explained the process which interested me. I think more education is needed.

Children are the future this will help them recycle correctly or even improve the system.
attributes.additional_details:
School is where we learn life skills, preparing us for adulthood. Recycling is currently not as efficient as it could be because the public are not fully educated. Personally I've attended beach cleans, researched where to recycle electronics / printer parts / clothes... It is all difficult to follow.

If schools had one lesson a year dedicated to recycling.
Maybe an expert from the industry could visit, they would learn the common mistakes of recyclers. Some would see it as a career path.

attributes.action: Create charter & new body for complaints about Local Authority Chief Executives
attributes.background: We need a new tribunal that would carry out hearings against Chief Executives in local authorities/councils who misuse their powers/cover up complaints/are awarded excessive salaries. The new body should recommend that individuals be prosecuted/sacked & recommend ways to reform the local authority.
attributes.additional_details: This new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate complaints itself, including being able to call Chief Executives/witnesses to appear, summon documents & records. Most importantly, it must include the complainants to ensure it has the confidence of the public. Currently those in our public services are able to misuse public money to defend themselves by using legal departments to cover up whilst the public face cutbacks to services. The public should have the right to challenge

attributes.action: Create a medal for those injured or killed whilst in service or on operations
attributes.background: I want the introduction of a medal to be automatically awarded to those members of the UK armed forces, and security and emergency services injured or killed whilst serving in any capacity during the course of their service or whilst on operations

attributes.action: Set up law to exempt spouse and parents of those KIA from council tax for life
attributes.background:
There is no law at present which exempts spouse and parents of those members of the armed forces, security services, NHS and police killed during their service or when on operations. 
To honour them, I want UK legislation to excuse their spouse and parents from council tax liability for life

attributes.action: Change restrictions on legal aid so that everyone can have 1 free appeal
attributes.background: Legal aid has strict criteria making it difficult unless on benefits to get free representation when convicted of a crime. The criteria should be changed allowing anyone the right to have legal aid for the appeal process regardless of people earnings.
attributes.additional_details: People that are wrongfully convicted have no chance of appeal unless they pay for representation and this can be an average cost of £5000. Most people in the United Kingdom are denied the chance due to criteria. If household income is less than £40,000 a year people should have the right to legal aid and appeals

attributes.action: Increase the annual salary of all public sector workers by 3%.
attributes.background:
We, the people of Britain, would like to request an increase of the annual salary for all public sector workers by 3%. In particular, the pay wage of Police, Firefighters and workers of the NHS. 

We feel that the wages should be increased because of the heroic services they provide everyday.
attributes.additional_details:
"The starting salary for Police Officers in England, Wales and Northern Ireland is between £19,971 and £23,124, rising to £38,382 at the top of the scale - achievable after about seven years.."

"Public Sector workers help you when you need it, no matter how bad of a situation. Some make you feel safe and risk their whole life for us, saving lives. They train and dedicated their life to make sure the people of Britain are safe and secure in the area that they live. They deserve more." - Nameless

attributes.action: Introduce Online Sales Tax to fund NHS spending increase
attributes.background:
The Government has "gifted" the NHS an extra £20bn of our money, proposed through raising yet more tax on middle and higher income earners!

An Online Sales Tax directed against Google, Amazon, eBay, Twitter etc should be used to offset tax rises for stretched families and save our high street.
attributes.additional_details:
Amazon and Google both generated £7bn in sales revenue in 2017.  A new OST of 12% (on top of VAT) would generate £1.8bn per annum alone.  Facebook did £850m in sales, generating another £100m OST for the pot.

Middle and higher income earners are not a limitless well of money for the Government to keep dipping into.  The top 1% of income earners already pay more than 28% of all income tax.  This is unsustainable in the long term and we need to reduce taxes & seek efficiency savings.

attributes.action: Provide clarity around the powers & legislation of bailiffs & civil enforcement
attributes.background: Civil enforcement agencies and bailiffs are a private entity which are used to recover debt. There have been a large number of cases where these enforcement agents are providing misleading information occupiers at properties which generally leaves no choice but to make payments in full.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to this lack of clarity police are called to such instances around 89% of times, wasting police time as they can not enforce anything except ensure there is no breach in peace as the matter is of a civil nature. 

If warrants had stated thereon the powers of entry a bailiff or enforcement may have according to the type of warrant they are present to execute, this would be beneficial all parties including the police as they generally have no knowledge about the rights of these agents

attributes.action: Introduce a minimum rate of tax on tax avoidance schemes to help fund the NHS
attributes.background: The introduction of a minimum income/corporate tax rate for individuals/companies would immediately raise tens of billions in additional tax receipts each year to help fund the NHS without the need to raise existing tax rates for the middle-classes, cut funding for benefits or borrow more money.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, tax avoiders can legally reduce the tax liability on their income to next to nothing without any restriction or recourse!

Any individual/company based in the UK that uses a known avoidance scheme or has connected parties/subsidiaries whose effective tax rate is less than 15% should pay the new minimum tax rate. 
The New 15% Minimum Tax Rate will apply to UK income and to all income recorded in low tax jurisdictions whether or not it is remitted back to UK.

attributes.action: Increase the national living wage for all UK workers over 18 to £10.50 per hour.
attributes.background: We are privileged to live in a nation of immense wealth and opportunity but it is a sad and shameful fact that this wealth is not more evenly distributed amongst the working population.
attributes.additional_details: It must be recognised by all that the social, educational and economic opportunities that are available to citizens who are paid the current living wage/minimum wage are considerably less than those individuals who are fortunate enough to earn more. Any civilised society should strive to protect its citizens from exploitation and hardship by ensuring that the national living wage is fair and equal for all workers over the age of 18 irrespective of contract or skill.

attributes.action: Ban outdoors barbecuing of meat & fish.
attributes.background: Just as the weather has warmed up so has the preponderance for barbecuing outdoors. Being able to enjoy time in the garden is spoiled by the disgusting smell of burning flesh and barbecue smoke.
attributes.additional_details: The char is laden with cancer-causing compounds called heterocyclic amines that form when meat and high heat are combined to create a blackened crust. Barbecue smoke contains polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons toxic chemicals that can damage your lungs.

attributes.action: Remove the household means assessment from student loans for all adult students.
attributes.background:
Parental maintenance cease at 18. The UK government assesses an entitlement to a student loan for an adult upon the income of people who live in their household but may have had no previous financial responsibility for ? 
Allow all students to apply for the maximum award. It’s all repayable
attributes.additional_details: The student loan assessment is unfair. A common example is where a students mother lives with a new partner. The partner earns a good salary and pays maintenance for his existing children - however the student applying for university must ask this man, who s/he may only have known for a year for their financial details. Then will be awarded a lesser sum because of this man income . With the expectation that he will top up the reduced loan. This rarely happens leaving the student disadvantaged.

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement to have a valid horse owners certificate to own a horse
attributes.background: Currently any individual can own a horse or pony regardless of their knowledge of basic horse care. This has led to a rise in equine welfare cases, with many horses/ponies being neglected, abused and killed due to the owners lack of fundamental equine care knowledge.
attributes.additional_details: The horse owners certificate is already an optional qualification provided by the British horse society. It teaches a person essential knowledge on equine maintenance, nutrition, care and first aid. Making this qualification a legal requirement for all horse owners will have a dramatic positive effect in the equestrian community and will aim to massively reduce the number of welfare cases involving horses inappropriately cared for.

attributes.action: Compulsory training for food establishments with an FSA score of less than 3
attributes.background: We want the law changed in that all food establishments who score below a 3 on a hygiene inspection by the FSA, are required to take on an outside agency to retrain staff and owners. Should their scores not improve following training, then they should be closed down.
attributes.additional_details:
Having become aware of establishments that are allowed to stay open despite having a low FSA score and potentially putting the general public at risk due to their lack of management skills, hygiene & food safety, there now is a serious need for the system to be looked at.
At present anyone can open a food outlet, whether it be a restaurant, cafe, takeaway, outside catering or a bakery, with only the requirement of a certificate; which can easily be obtained online. Whilst this promotes & aids businesses, it also opens the floodgates to public safety. The training would be at the cost of the business. It would create jobs as well as assisting the businesses in gaining the scores that they should have & maintain high standards in the food industry & public safety.

attributes.action: By law all Emergency Services Persons to be served before members of public
attributes.background: To make it compulsary by law that all on duty uniformed emergency services personnel are served at the front of ques in retail and food outlets to speed up the effieciency and working environments thus improving our response times and quality of staff

attributes.action: Companies to accept all holiday requests from families during school holidays.
attributes.background: For those being told that they can’t have a certain week off and then left to find AND PAY for childcare because their existing provider is closed! Leaving them to give their child to a stranger which is expensive and potentially puts them at risk. All requests to be accepted even if they overlap
attributes.additional_details: I propose we make it legal that if you have 1 or more children under 16 and you request a week off during the school holidays to cover childcare, your company cannot refuse. Currently each company have their own rules around staffing, 1 person off at a time for example. Meaning you need to find a stranger to watch your child and pay for the risky privilege. Companies refuse to pay for cover for that week and we lose out. It helps families financially in a big big way and also stops worry.
